casebody.data:
Gus Walker v. The State. No. 21846. Delivered January 14, 1942.

The opinion states the case.

Carpenter & Boling, of Lubbock, for appellant. Spurgeon E. Bell, State’s Attorney, of Austin, for the State. DAVIDSON, Judge.

The conviction is for selling whisky in a dry area. The punishment assessed is a fine of $200.00.

This case is similar in all respects to that of Gus Walker v. State, No. 21,847, this day decided.

*159The charge of the court in this case is subject to the same defects pointed out and upon which a reversal of that case was ordered.

For the same reason the judgment of the trial court in this case is reversed and the cause remanded. '

The foregoing opinion of the Commission of Appeals has been examined by the Judges of the Court of Criminal Appeals and approved by the Court.
